newsitem.title: USA: Supertel Q4 net hurt by occupancy, costs.
newsitem.headline: Supertel Q4 net hurt by occupancy, costs.

text.p: Supertel Hospitality Inc said Thursday lower occupancy rates and higher operating costs contributed to a slight decline in earnings in the fourth quarter ended December 31.
The company reported net income of $614,957, or $0.13 a share, compared to $626,097, or $0.13 a share, a year ago. Revenues rose to $9.7 million from $7.4 million in 1995.

Supertel, which increased its room count to 4,136 rooms in 1996 from 3,295, said occupancy in the period slipped to 60.3 percent from 62.4 percent. The company said it plans to add 400 to 600 rooms in 1997.
Supertel owns and operates 59 motel properties.
